meanings.definition: A person who is identical with another in every respect.
meanings.sent1: Tom and Jerry are like quines, they both love pizza and cartoons.
meanings.sent2: The twins dressed alike and acted alike, making them quines in the eyes of everyone.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the two dogs behave like quines, even wagging their tails in sync.
meanings.sent4: Their synchronized dance moves made them look like quines on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The mirror image twins were the perfect example of quines, even their laughter sounded the same.

meanings.definition: A computer program that takes its own source code as input and produces a copy of its own source code as output.
meanings.sent1: The quine program was so clever, it could replicate itself without any external help.
meanings.sent2: Programmers were amazed by the simplicity and complexity of the quine code.
meanings.sent3: The quine program seemed to be playing a game of 'copycat' with itself.
meanings.sent4: The quine code was like a digital mirror, reflecting itself endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The quine software was a digital marvel, creating its own clone with precision and accuracy.
